result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph P Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes:
Court costs ($243) and DNA surcharge ($200) are to be paid as a Condition of Probation.

  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Joseph P Clark in court with attorney Reisha Mitchell.

Defendant pleads No Contest to count 2.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 2.
Count 1 is dismissed as a read-in.

Court orders the following:
Count 2:
30  Days in the Waukesha County Jail Straight-Time
Stayed.
  
TERM OF PROBATION: 12 Months;
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia.
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).

COURT COSTS:  $243
DNA SURCHARGE:  $ 200
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Hearing on October 6, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Joseph P Clark in court with attorney Reisha Mitchell.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court addresses non compliance WCS letter.  State does not make any statements as to the WCS letter. Court takes no action on the bail. NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for October 6, 2014 at 03:00 pm.
for Non-Compliance with WCS.  EXT=Code 2
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Preliminary hearing on September 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joseph P Clark in court with attorney Reisha Mitchell.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived. Court addresses the letter from WCS with the defendant. Defendant stated that he now has insurance and will be enrolling into some outpatient treatment program. Court does not change the bail.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 12, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Wisconsin Community Service non-compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on August 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Joseph P Clark in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant needs more time to go to the public defender's office. Court adjorns the matter and the time limits are tolled for the preliminary hearing.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 19, 2014 at 10:00 am.
Hearing on August 4, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.   Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program or the Justice Point Program in Milwaukee County.

Defendant Joseph P Clark in court.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to apply at Public Defender's Office for representation.  Preliminary  Hearing time limits tolled.  Hearing scheduled for August 4, 2014 at 10:00 am.
